intro: Licaria cervantesii, commonly known as the Mexican licaria, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
